encryptionExplanation: 這是一項實驗性功能，將加密 (在伺服器端) 使用此應用程式建立或上傳的所有檔案。這並非端對端的加密。如果您忘記儲存桶加密金鑰，您將丟失加密檔案的內容。請謹慎使用！

Indexing is currently disabled for this location.
Would you like to force a reindex?
tagDelimiterChange: Changing Tag Delimiter will hide current tags with the old delimiter
obChooseTaggingTitle: Choose the default tagging method for files
obChooseTaggingFilename: Use the file name to save tags – tagging the file 'image.jpg' with the tag 'sunset' will rename it to 'image[sunset].jpg'
obChooseTaggingSidecar: Use a sidecar file to save tags – tagging the file 'image.jpg' with the tag sunset will store the tag in a dedicated file named 'image.jpg.json' inside a subfolder called '.ts'
obChooseTaggingClarification: You can change this option later. Files already tagged using the renaming method will remain renamed.
obWebClipperMain: With the TagSpaces Web Clipper, you can collect web pages, bookmarks, or screenshots from the Internet. In the desktop app, the built-in text editors let you create digital notes with tables, to-do lists, math formulas, or diagrams.
obWebClipperClarification: Check out our Web Clipper extension for Chrome, Edge, and Firefox. It’s free and available in the official browser stores.
obExplanationsMain1: TagSpaces can connect to folders on your hard drive or S3 object storage. It provides a convenient way to browse and manage the content of these connected folders, which we call locations. You can add tags to any file or folder.
obExplanationsMain2: In TagSpaces Pro, you can add descriptions and geo-tags to your files and folders. On top of that, we offer various views for your folders, which we call perspectives.
obFinalTitle: We hope you’ll love TagSpaces as much as we do!
obFinalExplanation: To learn more about how to use the application, please start the introduction from the welcome screen.
htsIntro: This guide will walk you through some of the key areas and features of the application. We highly recommend it for first-time users.
htsLocationManager: To use a folder in TagSpaces, you must connect it as a location with the Location Manager. The Location Manager allows you to create, edit, remove, import, and export your locations. Any default locations pointing to folders such as Documents or Downloads can be removed if not needed.
htsCreatingLocation: By selecting the highlighted button, you can open a dialog to choose which folder you'd like to use in TagSpaces and create a location linked to it. Depending on the type of location, the folder can be on your computer or in S3-compatible cloud storage such as AWS S3, Cloudflare R2, Wasabi, or Minio.
htsTagLibrary: The Tag Library is where you can manage and organize the tags you use for your files and folders. Tag Groups help you categorize tags, and applying a tag is as simple as dragging and dropping it onto a file or folder.
htsQuickAccess: This section gives you quick access to some important items:
htsQuickAccessSection1: Saved searches you can reuse anytime
htsQuickAccessSection2: Bookmarks for your favorite files and folders
htsQuickAccessSection3: A history of recently opened files
htsQuickAccessSection4: A list of your recently edited files
htsQuickAccessSection5: A list of recently opened folders
htsPerspectiveSwitch: Perspectives let you view your files in different ways. Use the highlighted switcher to change how the current folder is displayed.
htsPerspectiveGrid: Grid – shows files and folders as tiles for easy browsing
htsPerspectiveList: List – displays files and folders in a clean, sortable table
htsPerspectiveGallery: Gallery – optimized for folders with images and photos
htsPerspectiveMapique: Mapique – displays geo-tagged files and folders on an interactive map
htsPerspectiveKanban: Kanban – transforms any folder into a visual Kanban board
htsPerspectiveFolderViz: FolderViz – visualizes the folder structure as an interactive tree
htsCreatingFiles: Click the highlighted button to open a menu where you can choose the format for your new file:
htsCreatingFilesMD: Markdown (recommended) – perfect for notes with simple formatting
htsCreatingFilesHTML: HTML – ideal for rich-text documents with advanced formatting
htsCreatingFilesText: Text – create plain text files without formatting
htsCreatingFilesAudio: Audio – capture voice notes or other recordings
htsCreatingFilesTemplates: Templates – start quickly with ready-made templates for different use cases
htsSettings: The highlighted button will open the application settings. There you can configure the color theme, language, default perspective, tagging method, and more. You can also adjust keyboard shortcuts and preferences for editing supported file types.
htsStartUsingTS: You can start using the app by creating a new location or opening an existing one from the Location Manager.
ptsWhySection1: TagSpaces is powered by its community, not by ads or data mining. When you purchase the Pro version, you’re investing in a privacy-first ecosystem that keeps your data under your control. Your support ensures ongoing development of TagSpaces Lite and our free browser extensions—tools that remain accessible to everyone.
ptsWhySection2: Upgrade to Pro and supercharge TagSpaces with advanced search, unique perspectives for effortless organization, and powerful geo-tagging. Discover how these features can transform your workflow in the slides ahead.
ptsKanban: This perspective turns any folder into a fully functional Kanban board. Subfolders become columns, and the files inside them are displayed as cards that can be easily moved between columns using drag and drop. Entire columns can also be rearranged in the same way. Plus, with the built-in Trello import, you can bring exported Trello boards directly into your workspace.
ptsFolderViz: FolderViz brings your files and folders to life with interactive visualizations. It offers multiple views to help you better understand and manage your data:
ptsFolderVizTagGraph: Tag Graph – Visualize all tags and their related entries within a location.
ptsFolderVizLinksGraph: Links Graph – Explore connections between files, folders, and linked websites.
ptsFolderVizFolderTree: Folder Tree – View the folder structure behind your search results.
ptsFolderVizCircularFolderTree: Circular Folder Tree – Quickly spot folders with a high number of files.
ptsFolderVizTreeMap: Treemap – Easily identify large files that take up space.
ptsMapiqueSection1: The Mapique Perspective displays geo-tagged files and folders directly on an interactive map. It can automatically extract location data from JPEG  metadata, letting you place files where they belong geographically.
ptsMapiqueSection2: Add your own geo-tags to files and folders for powerful use cases such as trip planning, visualizing photo collections, or keeping private location-based notes.
ptsGallery: Perfect for organizing photos and images, the Gallery Perspective includes a clean presentation mode. Simply hit play to enjoy a slideshow of your images in sequence—or switch to full-screen for a distraction-free, immersive experience.
ptsAITitle: Automate Your Workflow with Local AI
ptsAI: TagSpaces Pro can connect to Ollama or other local AI services, giving you access to powerful automation features:
ptsAISection1: Content summarization – for text, Markdown, HTML, and PDF files.
ptsAISection2: Image descriptions – automatically generate captions for JPG and PNG files.
ptsAISection3: Smart tag extraction – from text, documents, and images.
ptsAISection4: Batch processing – apply these features across multiple files at once.
ptsAINote: Note: TagSpaces itself does not include built-in AI. It integrates with external local LLM models for all AI functionality.
ptsAnnotateLinkTitle: Annotate and Link Your Files and Folders
ptsAnnotateLink: With Pro, you can enrich any file or folder with detailed descriptions, annotations, and links.
ptsAnnotateLinkSection1: Use Markdown for flexible, styled notes.
ptsAnnotateLinkSection2: Apply simple text formatting like bold and italic.
ptsAnnotateLinkSection3: Create to-do lists or numbered lists for tasks.
ptsAnnotateLinkSection4: Add links to documents, folders, locations, or web pages.
ptsAnnotateLinkSection5: Customize thumbnails for files and folders to visually highlight key content.
ptsRevisionsTitleSection1: Never lose track of changes again. TagSpaces Pro can automatically create file revisions—storing full copies of edited files (TXT, MD, HTML) so you can trace your work over time.
ptsRevisionsTitleSection2: Enable auto-save per file to ensure every change is saved instantly, keeping your progress safe at all times.
ptsCustomBackground: Make important folders stand out with custom background colors. Even when viewing parent directories, your color-coded folders remain visible. For example, highlight your 'Archive' folder in yellow so it’s always easy to spot.
ptsProWeb: Run TagSpaces directly in your browser with our web-based Pro edition, hosted securely on your infrastructure.
ptsProWebSection1: On-premises web version of TagSpaces Pro, perfect for self-hosting.
ptsProWebSection2: Optimized PWA mode for seamless use on mobile devices.
ptsProWebSection3: White-label customization with your branding, colors, and logos.
ptsProWebSection5: Premium technical support for your organization.
ptsProWebSection6: Custom development available, including tailored file viewers, perspectives, and full AWS cloud deployments with user management and MFA/2FA support.
shortNameMaxLength: Short name should be max. 5 characters
